## See also[edit]


* ![flag](image)India portal
* ![](image)Cities portal
* ![icon](image)Asia portal


</fragment>
<fragment>
Tallest buildings in Mumbai, India





![](image)Mumbai's Lower Parel Skyline
![](image)Mumbai's Skyline across Back Bay
Mumbai, the commercial and financial capital of India, has the highest number of skyscrapers and high-rise buildings in India. More than 200 skyscrapers and 4,000[1] high-rise buildings have already been constructed in the city of Mumbai. (A skyscraper is defined as a continuously habitable high-rise building that has over 40 floors and is taller than approximately 150 metres (492 ft) according to international standards.)


</fragment>
<fragment>

* List of tallest buildings in India
* List of tallest buildings and structures in the Indian subcontinent
* List of tallest buildings in different cities in India
* List of tallest buildings in Chennai
* List of tallest buildings in Navi Mumbai
* List of tallest buildings in Panvel


## References[edit]


</fragment>
<fragment>

1. **^** "Mumbai Skyscrapers". Archived from the original on 15 June 2015.
2. **^** "Palais Royale Mumbai; Tallest Structure of India". *Justbaazaar.com*. Retrieved 14 May 2022.
3. **^** "Supreme Court clears India's tallest project Palais Royale | Mumbai News - Times of India". *The Times of India*.
4. ^ ***a*** ***b*** "Lokhandwala Minerva". *CTBUH Skyscraper Center*.
5. ^ ***a*** ***b*** "Official Website". www.lokhandwalainfrastructure.com. Retrieved 26 October 2010.
6. ^ ***a*** ***b*** New TALLEST buildings in India! - Rediff.com Business. Rediff.com (5 August 2011). Retrieved on 6 December 2013.
7. **^** "Nearing completion: India's tallest Skyscraper - Lokhandwala Minerva". *windtechconsult.com*. Retrieved 26 December 2022.
8. **^** "Lokhandwala ropes in Shapoorji Pallonji to complete Minerva". *devdiscource.com*. Retrieved 26 December 2022.
9. **^** "Piramal Aranya Arav". *CTBUH Skyscraper Center*.
10. **^** "World One". *CTBUH Skyscraper Center*.

</fragment>
<fragment>

The first skyscrapers in Mumbai were constructed during the 1970s, when Usha Kiran and Matru Mandir were developed and stood at about 76 metres (250 feet), or 25 floors, each. After a significant lull, construction projects since the mid-1990s began taking the skyline upwards, with a major acceleration in the pace of development since 2000, when the Lower Parel area began developing. Palais Royale structurally topped out in 2018 and is the tallest building in the country with a height of 320 meters.




## List of tallest buildings in Mumbai[edit]


This list ranks the tallest completed and topped out buildings in Mumbai that stand at least 150 m (492 ft) as of October 2023. This includes spires and architectural details but does not include antenna masts.



Was the tallest building in Mumbai and India upon completion.




</fragment>
<fragment>

This lists ranks the 252 buildings that are under construction in Mumbai and are planned to rise at least 150 metres (492 ft) or 40 floors tall. Proposed buildings are not included in this table.






</fragment>
</document>

## Notes[edit]

<fragment>
![](image)New Delhi skyline
![](image)Supernova Spira The tallest Building in the Delhi NCR region
![](image)Gateway Tower, Gurugram
This list enumerates high-rise buildings and skyscrapers[1][2] in the city of Delhi, the capital and the largest metropolis of India, along with its adjoining NCR areas. Currently there are more than 5,200[3][4][5][6][7] high-rise buildings in the Delhi NCR area with thousands more under construction. Supernova Spira which topped out in 2022 is currently the tallest building in Delhi NCR with a height of 300 metres (984 ft) consisting of 80 floors.



![](image)Cyber Green Hub Building

## Tallest buildings[edit]


This list ranks buildings in Delhi NCR that stand at least 125 metres (410 ft), based on standard height measurement or are 35 floors tall, as of October 2023. [8][9][10][11] This includes spires and architectural details but does not include antenna masts. Only completed buildings and under-construction and on-hold buildings that have been topped out are included.


</fragment>
<fragment>
91. ^ ***a*** ***b*** Sidharatha Roy (29 October 2019). "Once Delhi's tallest building, iconic Vikas Minar is all set for a facelift". *The Times of India*. Retrieved 5 August 2021.

## Timeline of tallest buildings of Bangalore[edit]




</fragment>
<fragment>
![](image)UB Tower
![UB CITY](image)Bangalore's skyline viewed from Central Business District
![](image)CNTC Presidential Tower, the tallest residential Tower in Bengaluru
![UB City](image)Bangalore's Skyline viewed from Central Business District during the night
![Image taken from ISKON](image)Bangalore's skyline viewed from Yeshwantpur
This **list of tallest buildings in Bengaluru** ranks high-rise buildings and skyscrapers in Bengaluru, India.


</fragment>
<fragment>

As of now there are almost 1,500[1] high-rise buildings and 2 skyscrapers that have already been constructed in Bengaluru and many more high-rise buildings are currently under construction in the city right now.




## Tallest buildings[edit]


This lists ranks buildings in Bengaluru that stand at least 100 metres (328 ft) or 30 floors from the ground. This includes spires and architectural details but does not include antenna masts. Only completed buildings and under-construction buildings that have been topped out are included.






</fragment>
<fragment>

Bengaluru is witnessing a huge high-rise boom with many skyscrapers being built in different parts of the city. Being the technology capital of India makes it one of the fastest growing mega cities in the world. The influx of high-skilled individuals from all parts of India come here for job and business opportunities. This is the reason why there is always demand for office and living space within the city and as a result Bengaluru is moving towards vertical development. CNTC Presidential Tower (topped-out in early 2023) is currently the tallest building in the city. It is 161 metres (528 ft) tall and has 50 floors. The World Trade Center (topped out in 2010) is currently the tallest commercial building in the city. It is 128 metres (420 ft) tall and has 32 floors. The World Trade Center, the UB Tower, the Mantri DSK Pinnacle, and Phoenix One Bangalore West are some of the various prominent skyscrapers in the city. 


</fragment>
</document>

![](image)*My Home Avatar, View from Outer Ring Road*
![](image)Offices and residential complex seen from Khajaguda lake



This **list of tallest buildings in Hyderabad[1]** lists the high-rises in Hyderabad, India.


Hyderabad is witnessing a massive construction boom around its IT corridor with several high-rise & skyscraper proposals getting approvals as there is huge demand for office and living space in the city.[2]


Several high-rises are already constructed in areas like Gachibowli, HITEC City, Raidurg, Kondapur, Manikonda, Kukatpally and numerous other buildings are currently under construction. Many real estate developments are taking place in newly planned areas like Neopolis, Kokapet and Gandipet. As of January 2023, Lodha Bellezza Towers 3, 4 & 5 (45 floors, 153 metres) are the tallest completed buildings of Hyderabad. The tallest project under-construction is Candeur Skyline with 4 towers with a height of 244 meters.

chat_history.name: search

chat_history.content:
Here are the tallest buildings in the five most populous cities in India:

1. **Mumbai**:
   - **Palais Royale**: 320 meters (1,050 feet), 88 floors. It is currently the tallest building in Mumbai.

2. **Delhi NCR**:
   - **Supernova Spira**: 300 meters (984 feet), 80 floors. It is the tallest building in the Delhi NCR region.

3. **Bangalore**:
   - **CNTC Presidential Tower**: 161 meters (528 feet), 50 floors. It is the tallest building in Bangalore.

4. **Hyderabad**:
   - **Lodha Bellezza Towers 3, 4 & 5**: 153 meters (502 feet), 45 floors. These are the tallest completed buildings in Hyderabad.

5. **Ahmedabad**:
   - **World Centre – 3**: 142 meters (466 feet). It is the tallest commercial building in Ahmedabad.

functions.name: search
functions.desc: Search Wikipedia for an article with the given title, and get its content. If no such article is found, return similar article names.
